1.01 | 1.02 | 1.03 | 1.04 | 1.05 | 1.06 | 1.07 | 1.08 | 1.09 | 1.10

Game Rules


Game Timeline
  • Day Phases will last two weeks.
  • Night Phases will last two days.

General Rules
  • Don't quote your role PM.
  • This is my color (#0000FF). Please don't use it.
  • Sharing PM or PT communication is forbidden. Paraphrasing is fine.
  • Keep all game talk in the game thread & PTs.
  • Do not use encrypted or hard-to-see text.
  • Don't publicly accuse other players of cheating.
  • Pretending to break a rule is the same as rulebreaking.
  • Don't play against your win condition.
  • Those modkilled become Neutral Survivors, and don't win.
  • I reserve the right to change the rules at any time. There'll be notice.
  • Scum win when their numbers equal or exceed that of the Town's.

Activity
  • 48 hour inactivity nets one prod.
  • If prod is ignored at 48 hours, forced replacement occurs.
  • 3 prods = forced replacement.
  • Slots not replaced within ten days are modkilled instead.
  • Be aware of any PMs from the mod.
  • If you plan to be absent for a period of time, please give notice.

Votes and Lynching
  • Votes must be in the format of VOTE: Player Name. Slight variation is fine, if legible.
  • Unvotes are not necessary to change a vote.
  • A player will be lynched if a simple majority of the players have voted for that player.
  • A lynch occurs when half of players +1—rounded down—vote the same person.
  • Once I have posted your death scene, you may not post. No "bah" posts.
  • You may change your vote as many times as you wish.
  • After a lynch has been made, all players including the one who was lynched may continue to post until I lock the thread.
  • If a majority of votes is not reached by deadline, there will be no lynch for that day.
  • You may vote not to lynch by saying [b]VOTE: No Lynch/VOTE: No Lynch.

Behavior
  • Harassment of an individual player is NOT permitted. While this is a competitive game, no personal attacks'll be tolerated.
  • Do not discuss this game anywhere else with anyone else unless your role allows you to.
  • Please don't replace out over hurt feelings.
  • If you die, do not continue posting in game or PT threads. Post only in Dead PT.

Setup
  • This game has a Day start.
  • This is a Closed Setup.
  • Scum have Daytalk.
  • Deadline extensions may be permitted.
  • There may be duplicate roles.
  • There may or may not be a Neighborhood(s).
  • If two NKs are attempted on a Bomb power role in the same Night phase, and they succeed, both players targeting it will die.
  • Roleblockers cannot be roleblocked.
  • Any role may be Town or Scum.
  • Mod is NOT infallible. If you suspect a mistake, please let me know via PM right away.
  • If a 1-Shot ability is used, and that player is roleblocked, he or she will have used up that shot.

Please read these rules one more time.


Sample Role PM:

Vanilla Townie

Welcome, [Player Name]. You are a Vanilla Townie.

Abilities:
Your weapons are your voice and your vote. You have no night actions.

Win condition:
You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated.

Assigning and sending out Role PMs tomorrow morning.

Please confirm in this thread.

Day 1 starts when 11/13 Role PMs are confirmed (13/13).

After speaking with N, I've decided to change the flavor of this game to classic rock music. The educational book meant to be used for the flavor of this game has been discovered stolen, so I'm having to improvise. This flavor change will not affect the game in any other way.

[3/22/15] I've decided to extend the deadline by four days, and extend Days to the typical 2-week period.
Confirm
Word up, home cheese.
I am here.
Cinfirm

Personally, I think it's more useful for people to contribute substance whenever possible. It helps towns progress in the day, and reveals nice info to go off on.

I can't say how scum would go about either lurking, or posting more, but I think scum would like to keep a low profile early in game. Since RVS, and D1 is mostly about people throwing around what they think about something, and voting whenever they feel is appropriate despite actual evidence that indicates scum.

In short answer: I think scum would rather hold back and observe for a few pages, but I townie can do just the same.

EBWOP: It was supposed to inspire a chuckle. We're playing mafia and the theme of mafia generally features anti-town factions based upon the mafia/mob. Mafia are well known for shooting people. Ergo the obvious strategy to beat mafia is to wear body armor.

In hindsight, I really should have realized that people needed to realize way too many points along that train of thought to get the joke.

Failure to stay active and provide a very clear contrast between the active players and the lurksacks is a bad thing and causes a lot of problems, in my experience. One of the biggest problems with a slow day phase is that it allows scum to just easily hide and avoid leaving the vital clues necessary for us to win later on. Only by getting everyone to actually engage in the game and be active will we maybe find some actual slips or something to go on so that day one doesn't get dominated by obsession over non-issues.

Realistically I know we can't force people to say more than they want to, but applying pressure should force them to at least commit something to the game for later analysis, as day one usually becomes a source of lots of useful information later on. Poking the lowest activity players and possibly using some votes (hopefully others will help me) might force everyone to engage and commit to the game today though.

Tomorrow, if this weird activity thing hasn't sorted itself, I am going to use a less scattershot approach to prodding the lurkers into acting. Everyone who is currently skating by without really putting anything of note into the thread should take notice and start participating; be part of the solution instead of more of the problem for us to overcome. Lulls in activity like this aren't really something I expect when a game starts out so active and features a few players really driving the game (Col. Cathart comes immediately to mind).

Lurksacks, incidentally, are the players that I find myself really disliking a lot. Usually they have a negative impact on the game because they are either scum skating through until the late game, or they are useless town who scum can use for late lynches, especially when it comes down to MYLO/LYLO situations. Barring real life complications, everyone should be able to make some actual contribution to the game thread at least every day or two, if not more often.

This is probably the only time I'm going to direct this to the game in general instead of going after people who continue to be lurksacks. I'm done being super busy for awhile and this is your warning that I'm coming.

It was a prod dodge, mostly. I saw a note that I would be prodded soon. I gave the real life context for being busy, but you seem to have missed it so I will expand. In my profession I have many gaps of time that last for a few minutes at a time as I wait between class times after answering student questions and before the next class begins, or between student appointments during office hours, and many similar such things. It is rarely possible for me to get any significant work done in these times; certainly it's not really possible for me to allocate that time to my own research and writing endeavors. Thus, I found myself looking through free apps on my iPhone some months ago and came across an NBA themed one that connects with a game I play on my PC, and provides me some free currency daily that I would otherwise have to pay for. It also features short little "card battles" that take about 30 seconds, making it fairly perfect for the little spaces of otherwise useless times I have in my life.

Every so often, this app features something called a "Rival's Clash" pitting two teams against each other. The most recent one started yesterday and will continue through Sunday. I doubt I shall do this ever again, but I decided I would like to finish in the top 100 in the event's leaderboard, and get a nice reward in the app for doing so.

So, unless you lot get up to something truly interesting soon, I'm likely to keep watching and taking notes and doing my thing. My job is to pay attention and analyze what people say and try to figure out who the scum are so I can convince the rest of you lot to kill them. When I've got a solid case, you'll know it.

* - This is a term of logic and philosophy and it means that the logical chain is correct, but the premises have to be true; this is compared to the term "sound" which means that both the logic and the premises are true. When a logical case is "sound" it means that the conclusion must necessarily follow from the premises {Validity} and that the premises are true, while valid only requires that the conclusion be a necessary consequence of the premises. I'd rather people not crucify me because they don't know the difference between whether something is logically valid or logically sound. If you already knew this, then hooray for knowledge and you rock. If you didn't, hopefully this will help you in future games {and this one?} to sort through things which you know to be true, and things which might be true.

@Dragonspawn - Thanks for the reads. When you get back ... are you familiar with the difference between Deductive and Inductive reasoning? What you've done looks much more deductive (start with a theory and look for evidence that can support or invalidate it) than inductive (start by examining the evidence and letting it take you to the theory). The problem with deductive reasoning in mafia is that you cannot rely on everything you see in the game to be true or accurate. A second problem with deductive reasoning in mafia is that it's not easy to distinguish a townie making an honest effort to evaluate the various possibilities (as your post appears to do) from a scum who has a particular theory he wants to try and sell to the game. Both the townie and the scum will put up posts that appear to be deductive (excepting cases where very good scum can make their case look inductive).

The best approach for a townie is always inductive. Don't theorize anything on your first pass. Go through the game and interactions and see what they tell you. This should generally give you some competing valid theories. The second pass is where you test those theories by whichever method suits you. My approach is twofold. I first try and find something that makes a particular theory unlikely or something that causes confusion. If I can cross out a theory for good reasons, then that helps me narrow things down. I also try and do a very honest evaluation where I assume someone is town and see if his posts and actions make sense from a town mindset, and then assume that the same person is scum and see if the posts and actions make sense from that mindset. I've caught a lot of scum by assuming they were town and having a lot of posts and actions that didn't make sense or were not consistent with other parts of their play. I've also cleared people I was sure were scum because there was no viable scum motive that made sense of their posts and actions, but being a townie in the dark totally made it all make sense.

This approach is why I'm so sure of my theory explaining what we saw yeSterday (someone recently introduced me to this: yestderday = real life yesterday while yeSterday = the prior day phase yesterday; same with toMorrow and tomorrow).

A valid case is one where if the premises are true, the conclusion is a necessary result of those premises. I'll give an example:

Premise A: Godfather exists in this game
Premise B: Shinobi investigated the Godfather and reported her as innocent to us

Conclusion: AA9 is the Godfather


If A and B are both true, then the conclusion necessarily follows from them. So I could make a Valid case against everyone in the game ... but there's a very wide gulf between valid and sound. Because this game wasn't just being polished for Normality, but also Balance, a few roles and ideas got cut.

The NRG does a good job trying to keep games balanced, though I really like my games being Normal and imbalanced.

Just having more stuff in a game and a sense of direness makes it that much more compelling, in my personal opinion.

One tiny thing changing from all of this is that Vanilla Townie will now simply be 'Citizen.' I like the name better. Smoother.

I need to try to get more VCs up and going each Day. I did not like how Days 3 and 4 didn't have enough VCs.

What the end result for my games should be is a scarce, simplistic approach. Minimalistic, perhaps? Almost stylish in its simplicity.

Role Cop is a budding favorite role now, and Gunsmith is very subtle, too. May actually use a Bomb in the future.

If there were even weaker/more subtler versions of our typical whitelisted roles, it'd add better layers of complexity to it.

Dragonspawn, Varsoon, and Klingoncelt were damned good this game. They complemented each other, and got the job done.

I'll be using 11 pre-ins, and use WotM to ensure my invited players have slots to play in (or at least better control who I want in).

As for goodmorning, I know she's a good player, and a shoe-in. You may be better able to convince her than I can to join.

Before I attempt 30-player+ Kirby Large Theme, I want to try a massive 30-player Large Normal her first, and see it Balanced.

That way I'll take the slow and steady route towards modding much bigger and better games. I want to be a better game mod.

Also, in my games at least, if I have a Doc and Cop, always assume the Cop is Macho. 'Follow the Cop' is not very fair.

Hubbub aside, the games I run are going to get bigger and better. They're gonna require both thoroughness and commitment.
